en: What is Uniting for Ukraine?
nya: Kodi mgwirizano wa dziko la Ukraine ndichani?

en: The program allows U.S. citizens and residents to sponsor Ukrainian refugees under different immigration statuses. The online portal, open to potential sponsors or organizations, is accepting applications and has received more than 4,000 requests so far, CNN reported.
nya: Ndondomekoyi imalola mzika za dziko la America ndi anthu othawa dziko la Ukraine pa zifukwa zosiyanasiyana.  Chipata cha intaneti, chomwe chinatsekulidwa kwa mabungwe ofuna kupereka chithandizo, chikulandira ma kalata ofunsira thandizoli ndipo makalata mazana anayı alandiridwa, kuchokera ku nyumba yofalitsa nkhani ya CNN.
mt0: The program allows Americans and Ukrainians to leave Ukraine for various reasons. The website, which was opened to organizations willing to provide assistance, receives letters requesting assistance and hundreds of letters are received, from CNN.

en: Who qualifies under the program?  Ukrainians, or an immediate family member of a Ukrainian citizen. They must have a U.S. sponsor and have been a resident of Ukraine as of February 11.
nya: Amene akuyenera kutsata ndondomekoyi ndindani? Anthu a ku Ukraine, wachibale kwa mzika ya dziko la Ukraine. Akuyenera kukhala ndi munthu wowathandiza wa ku America komanso akhala mu dziko la Ukraine kuchokera mwezi wa February pa 11.
mt0: Who should follow the process? Ukraine, a Ukrainian citizen. They must have an American assistance agent and have been in Ukraine since February 11.

en: What are the requirements?   They must pass security checks — including a fingerprint and an FBI name check and biographic and biometric screening — and meet public health requirements, such as having the proper vaccinations, before entering the U.S.
nya: Zofunikira zake ndichani? Akuyenera kudutsa posechedwa ndi a  chitetezo kuphatitizapo kuyesa zidindo za zala zawo, kufufuza dzina lawo kwa apolisi a FBI,  kuyesa thupi lawo ndi makina, komanso kukhala ndi zoyenereza za umoyo ngati ma katemera onse asanalowe mu dziko la America
mt0: What are the requirements? They must pass through a security checkpoint, including a finger test, a FBI search of their name, a body scan, and a health clearance if all vaccines are taken before entering the United States.

en: Those approved will be allowed to travel to the U.S., be considered for humanitarian parole on a case-by-case basis, stay in the country for two years, and apply for work permits.
nya: Onse ovomelezedwa adzaloledwa kupita ku dziko la America, adzatengedwa ngati anthu othandizidwa pafupipafupi, akhale mu dzikolo kwa zaka ziwiri kenako kulembera ziphaso zowalola kugwira ntchito mu dzikolo.

en: "The United States strongly encourages Ukrainians seeking refuge in the United States who do not have and are not eligible for a visa to seek entry via Uniting for Ukraine from Europe. This will be the safest and most efficient way to pursue temporary refuge in the United States," a DHS statement said.

en: However, they can apply for Temporary Protected Status, which is another form of humanitarian relief that allows people to legally stay and work in the U.S.

mt0: But they can still sign temporary passports that are a way to help people stay legally and work in the United States.

en: What about those arriving at the U.S.-Mexico border?

en: Citing safety issues, U.S. officials have urged Ukrainians not to travel to Mexico in hopes of entering the United States. In addition, U.S. Customs and Border Protection has no place to hold them while they go through the Uniting for Ukraine vetting process.
nya: Kutengera zifukwa za chitetezo, akuluakulu a dziko la America apempha anthu a dziko la Ukraine kuti asapite ku dziko la Mexico ndi chiyembekezo chokalowera ku  dziko la America. Poonjezera apo, a malamulo ndi chitetezo cha malire a dziko la America alibe malo owasungira pamene akudikila dongosolo la mgwirizano wa dziko la Ukraine.
mt0: Because of security reasons, American officials have asked Ukraine citizens not to go to Mexico with the hope of entering the United States. In addition, American border and customs officials have no where to hide while they wait for the agreement of Ukraine.

en: Since Uniting for Ukraine's launch on Monday, Ukrainians who arrive at U.S. ports of entry without a valid visa or without preauthorization to travel to the United States through the Uniting for Ukraine program will be denied entry and told to apply to the program.
nya: Chitsegulireni mgwirizano wa dziko la Ukraine Lolemba, anthu ochokera ku dziko la Ukraine ofikira ku ma doko a dziko la America opanda chiphaso choyenera kapena kuloledwa kupita ku dziko la America kudzera mu mgwirizano wa dziko la Ukraine adzakanizidwa kulowa mu dzikolo ndi kulembera pologalamuyo.
mt0: Open the Ukraine-US Agreement on Monday. Ukrainian citizens entering the United States without a valid visa or a permit to enter the United States through the Ukraine-US Agreement will be barred from entering the country and signing the program.

en: Biden officials hope this will curb the number of Ukrainian migrants seeking humanitarian parole along the border.
nya: Ogwira ntchito a boma la a  Biden ali ndi chiyembekezo chakuti chiwerengero cha anthu olowa mdzikolo ochokera ku Ukraine kufuna chithandizo chichepa pa malire a dziko ławo.
mt0: The government of Biden is hopeful that the number of Ukrainian migrants entering the country seeking humanitarian aid will be smaller at the border.

en: Those at the border must apply under the rules of Uniting for Ukraine, meaning they must have a qualifying sponsor or a non-government agency willing to sponsor them in the U.S. for up to two years. And they need to have all required vaccinations and pass background checks.
nya: Anthu omwe ali pa malire a dzikolo akuyenera kulembera pansi pa malamulo a mgwirizano wa dziko Ła Ukrainę , kutanthauza kutiakuyenera kukhala ndi munthu wowathandiza woyenelera kapena nthambi yoti si ya boma imene yofuna kuwathandiza kwa zaka ziwiri mu dziko Ła America. Anthuwa akuyeneranso kukhalkuri anabayidwa katemera yense woyenera komanso anafufuzidwa bwino.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know. Ukrainian border residents must register under the agreement of the Ukrainian Union , which means that they must have a representative or a branch of the Ukrainian government that wants to help them for two years in the United States. They must also have a vaccination and a detailed examination.

en: The Biden administration announced the private sponsorship initiative as another way the U.S. hopes to achieve President Biden's commitment to welcome up to 100,000 Ukrainians displaced by the Russian military invasion.
nya: Boma la a Biden linalengeza  njira ina ya chithandizo ya payekha payekha  imene boma la America likuyenera kukwanitsa mu kudzipereka kwa mkulu wa dzikolo a Biden polandira anthu makumi khumi a dziko la Ukraine amene anasamutsidwa kamba ka kulowa mwaupandu kwa asilikali a ku Russia mu dziko ławo.
mt0: The Biden government announced a new assistance program that the United States must provide in response to the Biden's contribution to the rescue of the Ukrainians who were deported because of the invasion of Russia.

en: As of Thursday, almost 5.4 million refugees have since left Ukraine, according to U.N. data.

mt0: In the United Nations estimate, since Thursday, about 5.4 million people have fled Ukraine.

en: Report: Rwanda Should Ease Restrictions On 2003 National Elections - 2001-10-15
nya: Lipoti:  Dziko la Rwanda likuyenera kukhwepetsa malamulo mu chaka cha 2003 a zisankho za dzikolo, 2001-10-15
mt0: Report: Rwanda should lower its laws in 2003 for the national elections, 2001-10-15

en: In 2003 Rwanda will hold its first national elections since the 1994 genocide. A new report says the government of Rwanda needs to relax its control over public life if the polls are to have any credibility.
nya: Dziko la Rwanda  lipangitsa zisankho za dzikolo koyamba patatha kuphedwa kwa anthu kwa chipulula komwe kunachitika mu Chaka cha 1994. Lipoti latsopano lati kuti dziko la Rwanda likuyenera kuchepetsa mphavu zolamulira anthu ndi cholinga choti zisankhozi zikhale zodalirika.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know Rwanda is holding its first elections since the 1994 genocide. The new report says that Rwanda must reduce its powers to control the people in order to make the elections more reliable.

en: There was relief when the Rwandan Patriotic Front seized power in Rwanda in 1994, ending the genocide in which about 800,000 minority Tutsis and moderate Hutus were killed.
nya: Anthu anapepukidwa pamene chipani cha Patriotic Front chinatenga boma mu Chaka cha 1994, kuthetsa kupha kwa anthu mwaunyinji komwe kunapha ana ochepa okwana 800,000 a mtundu wa Tutsis ndi Hutus.
mt0: People were killed when the Patriotic Front took over in 1994, stopping the mass killing of 800,000 children of the Tutsis and Hutus.

en: The new military government promised to restore democracy to Rwanda via elections in 2003.
nya: Boma lastopano la asilikali linalonjeza kubwezeletsa ufulu wa ndale mu dziko la Rwanda kudzera mu zisankho za chaka cha 2003.
mt0: If you can't translate, just say you don't know.

en: That process began in March this year, with district elections.
nya: Ndondomeyi inayamba mwezi wa Malichi chaka chino ndi zisankho za mmaboma.
mt0: The debate began in March this year with the elections of the government.

en: Senior analyst Francois Grignon, of the International Crisis Group, a Brussels-based policy research organization, says he was disappointed with the district poll. Mr. Grignon says the process was so tightly controlled that he maintains no genuine opposition candidates were allowed to stand.
nya: Katswiri wamkulu wa bungwe lotchedwa  International Crisis group; a Francois Grignon, bungwe lakafukufuku la ku Brussels , anati ndiwokhumudwa ndi mmene zisankho zinayendera maboma. Mr Grignon anati mavotedwewa analamuliridwa kwambiri ndipo panalibe anthu otsutsa boma amene analoledwa kuimila nawo maudindowo.
mt0: The head of the International Crisis Group; Francois Grignon, a Brussels research group , said he was disappointed with the way the elections went. Mr Grignon said the votes were controlled by the government and there were no opposition candidates allowed to compete.

en: "There was a screening and there was a preparation of the elections, which did not allow other candidates than those who had been rubber-stamped by the government to actually contest, especially for the executive positions within the local authorities," he says. "If consensual democracy means that the political debate is actually handled before the electoral contest in such a way that it does not lead to a real competition then there is no democracy at all."
nya: “Panali kafukufuku komanso kukonzekera zisankhozo kumene sikunalole anthu ena omwe samaimila boma kupikisana nawo, makamaka oimila maudindo akuluakulu mu madera ang’onoang’ono.” Iwo anatero. “Ngati ufulu waaliyense ukutanthauza kuti kutsutsana pa ndale  kuchitika mpikisano wa zisankho usanachitike, mpaka kulepheretsa kuchitanso zisankho zenizeni, ndekuti palibe ufulu uliwonse.
mt0: "There was a political investigation and preparation that would not allow other non-governmental parties to compete with them, particularly those in the smaller areas." They said. "If any freedom means that political discord could occur before the election, until it would prevent the holding of real elections, then there is no freedom."

en: In a new report, titled Consensual Democracy in Post Genocide Rwanda, the International Crisis Group urges the international community to pressure Rwanda's government to liberalize political activity.
nya: Mu lipoti latsopano lotchedwa Consensual Democracy in Post Genocide Rwanda, gulu lapadziko lonse loona za mavuto lapempha gulu la pa dziko lonse kuti likakamize boma la Rwanda kukhazikitsa ufulu wa ndale.
mt0: In a new report called Consensual Democracy in Post-genocide Rwanda, the international agency for genocide prevention has asked the international community to pressure the government of Rwanda to establish political freedom.

en: The report notes that the military dominates public life and there is little open criticism of the government, either in the media or by opposition figures. The Rwanda government argues that allowing a range of opinions would be dangerous in a country struggling to come to terms with its bloody past.
nya: Lipotilo lapezanso kuti asilikali ndiomwe akulamulira  anthu komanso kunyoza boma, kudzera mu nyumba zofalitsa mawu kapena otsutsa boma. Boma la Rwanda latsutsa kuvomera maganizo  a anthu osiyanasiyana chifukwa izi zitha kukhala zoopsa ku dziko lomwe likufuna kukhazikika kutengera ndi kale lake loipa.
mt0: The report also found that soldiers are responsible for bullying and bullying the government, through media or opposition. The government of Rwanda has rejected opposition opinions because this could be dangerous for a country which wants to remain stable based on its former evil history.

en: But Mr. Grignon says dissent is simply being driven underground or outside Rwanda's borders.
nya: Mr Grignon anati kutsutsaku  kukumachitika mwachinsinsi kapena  kunja kwa malire a dziko la Rwanda.
mt0: Return only if you cannot translate. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: "Opponents to the regime have to flee the country or to join in rebel movements outside the country or in the Congo and no chance to express a different view," he says. "All the good policies that the government has been implementing - including the organization of the elections, national elections, presidential and parliamentary, in 2003 - will lack the credibility because they were not implemented in an environment that actually allowed a fair contest to take place," he says.
nya: “Anthu otsutsa boma amathawa dzikolo kapena kulowa nawo mmagulu oukila boma kunja kwa dzikolo kapena ku dziko la Congo komwe alibe mwayi wopereka maganizo ena”, iwo anatero. “Malamulo onse abwino amene boma lakhala likukhazikitsa- kuonjezerapo kulongosola zisankho, zisankho za maiko, za mtsogoleri komanso aphungu mu Chaka cha 2003- zidzasowa chilungamo chifukwa sizinakhazitsidwe pa malo ololela kupikisana kwachilungamo, iwo anatero.
mt0: "The opposition parties leave the country or join political groups outside the country or in the Republic of Congo where they have no opportunity to express their opinions," they said. "All the good laws which the government has been making - including the introduction of elections, elections of nations, elections of presidents and parliaments in 2003 - will be without justice because they were not applied in a fair environment," they said.

en: Mr. Grignon says greater freedom of expression would strengthen Rwanda's reconciliation process and enhance its chances of a peaceful future.
nya: Mr. Grignon  anati ufulu womasuka utha kulimbikitsa  njira yobwelera mchimake ku dziko la Rwanda komanso kuojezera mphamvu zodzetsa tsogolo la mtendere  mdzikolo.
mt0: Mr. Grignon said that free speech could encourage a path to a sustainable recovery in Rwanda and increase the power to promote a sustainable future for peace in the country.

en: He says the international community's involvement in reconstruction projects gives it the leverage to make this plain to the Rwandan government.
nya: Iwo anati kulowelera kwa gulu lapadziko lonse mu ntchito yomanga yomwe ikuchitika, kupeleka phindu ku dziko la Rwanda.
mt0: They said that the global participation in the construction of the Rwandan economy was a benefit to the country.

mt0: This is a good news because Callixte Mbarushimana is being held by French authorities. This is a good news because Rwanda issued a letter to him asking him to be tried for genocide in 1994 in Rwanda.

en: The Justice Minister also said Kigali will be cooperating with the International Criminal Court in the imminent prosecution of Mbarushimana.

en: The British and French foreign ministers travel to the Democratic Republic of Congo Monday to kickoff a three-day, four-nation tour of the troubled region of Central Africa.

en: UNICEF Pushes for Demobilizing Child Soliders Near Africa's Great Lakes - 2002-10-07
nya: Bungwe la UNICEF lalimbikitsa kwambiri kuletsa ana achisilikari oyandikila dera la  Great lakes ku Afilika- 2002-10-07

en: The United Nations children's agency, UNICEF, is pushing for child soldiers to be demobilized in Africa's Great Lakes region, as several peace drives there build momentum. The agency says funding is in place to help the children leave the military and restart their lives.
nya: Nthambi yoona za ana ya United nations, UNICEF, likulimbikitsa kuti ana achichepere achisilikali achotsedwe ku dera la Great lakes ku Afilika, pamene mtendere ochuluka umabweretsa mphamvu. Nthambiyi inati pali chithandizo cha chuma chomwe chithandizire anawa kusiya usilikari ndi kukayambiranso moyo wawo.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know. The United Nations Children's Fund, UNICEF, is calling for the removal of young soldiers from the Great Lakes region in Africa, where peace is increasing. The fund says there is financial support to help the children leave the military and start their own life.

en: UNICEF's top child protection official, Manuel Fontaine, says peace initiatives in Uganda, the Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda are making it possible to get more children under the age of 18 out of fighting units. "We insist that child soldiers could be demobilized, even in conflict situations. We should never wait for peace to get children out of any form of armed group. But, obviously, that's a better timing at the moment. It's more conducive to demobilization," Mr. Fontaine said.
nya: Mkulu woona za chitetezo cha ana ku bungwe la UNICEF, a Manuel Fontaine, anati njira zobweretsa mtendere ku Uganda, Congo ndi Rwanda zikupangitsa kuthekera kowachotsa ana ochepera zaka 18 mu malo omenyera nkhondo. "Tikukakamira  kuti asilikali achichepere achotsedwe ngakhale mu nyengo za kusamvetsetsana. Sitikuyenera kudikira nthawi yomwe pali mtendere kuti anawa achotsedwe mu magulu ankhondo. koma mwachidziwikire ino ndi nthawi yoyenera pakadali pano. yowasiyitsa , anatero a Fontane.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know. UNICEF's child protection chief Manuel Fontaine said peacekeeping efforts in Uganda, Congo and Rwanda are making it possible to remove under-18s from fighting zones. "We urge children to be released even in a tense situation. We don't need to wait for peace to leave children out of fighting. However, we certainly know that this is the right time to leave them," he said.

en: UNICEF's Manuel Fontaine says demobilization takes time and money. He says the children must first be found, and then removed from their government or rebel units. Then, resources are needed to help them rebuild their lives. That involves providing schools, vocational training and health care.

So, you are trying to build services in those communities that are broad services, that would be made available to all those children," Mr. Fontaine said.

Nthawi yakwana yoti ndichepetse kagwiridwe ka ntchito kuti ndizimwako tea wa Roiboos ndi akazi anga okondedwa nthawi  ya masana," iwo anatero.

nya: iwo amadzudzula ulamuliro wa azungu wa mu dziko la South Africa ndipo amalimbikitsa kuthetsa kusalana mopanda kuchita nkhanza. A Tutu analandira nyota zambiri, mu chaka cha 1984 analandira nyota yolimbikitsa mtendere ndi ufulu posasankha mtundu wa anthu.
mt0: They criticize the colonial rule of South Africa and advocate for a non-violence settlement. Tutu received many awards, in 1984 he received a prize for promoting peace and freedom without racial selection.

en: " He used the recognition to step up the anti-apartheid campaign, calling for an economic boycott against South Africa. After the end of apartheid, Tutu called it an incredible day when Nelson Mandela won South Africa's first all-race elections.
nya: Kudziwika kwawo ndikomwe iwo amagwiritsa ntchito polimbikitsa kuthetsa mchitidwe wosalana, kuletsa kuchita malonda osiyanasiyana  mu dziko la South Africa. en: "I would say the highest point for me was when I stood on the balcony in 1994 to introduce our new, brand new president to South Africa and the world," he said.

mt0: "The most successful time for me was when I stood on the shore in 1994 to announce the new leader of South Africa and the world," they said.

en: To help mend the nation, President Mandela appointed Tutu as head of the country's Truth and Reconciliation Commission. The group issued a report that included numerous confessions of guilt under apartheid in return for amnesty.
nya: Pothandizira kukonza dziko, mtsogoleri wa dzikolo a Mandela anasankha a Tutu kukhala mkulu wa oyendetsa chilungamo ndi mgwirizano. Gululi linatulutsa lipoti lomwe linakamba zinthu zambiri kuphatikizapo anthu omwe amalapo ndi zoipa zomwe anachita mu nthawi ya utsamunda.
mt0: To help restore the country, the country's leader Mandela chose Tutu to be the head of justice and cooperation. The group issued a report which covered many things including the prisoners and the evils they did during the apartheid era.

en: "It makes specific proposals on how we can cultivate a culture of human rights and of structures to insure that the atrocities of the past will not reoccur," Tutu said.Tutu also campaigned to fight poverty and AIDS.
nya: "Ma pempho apaderadera  ndi amene angachititse kuti tikhazikitse ufulu komanso njira zoonetsetsa kuti mchitidwe wankhanza wakale sudzachitikanso," anatero a Tutu. A Tutu analimbikitsanso kulimbana ndi umphawi komanso matenda a Edzi.

en: Despite his withdrawal from public life, Tutu says he will continue to support his peace foundation and will remain part of a group of elder statesmen who campaign for peace and human rights.

en: "I have been part of our struggle for freedom and democracy, and I am part of the celebration that we did succeed," he said. "I have been part of the post apartheid dispensation and long for us to do infinitely better."Many say his voice will be missed.

en: Economists Predict Bumpy Road for Malawi's Economy in 2015
nya: Olondoloza  zachuma aneneratu kuti chuma cha dziko la Malawi chitha osayenda bwino mu chaka cha 2015.
mt0: The financial watchdog predicted that Malawi's economy would be struggling in 2015.

en: Economists in Malawi say the country is likely to continue facing financial challenges in 2015 unless the government can regain the confidence of donors, who are still withholding 40 percent of budgetary support due to the corruption scandal known as Cashgate. More than $30 million were looted from government coffers in the scandal, and several people, including government officials, were arrested.
nya: Olondoloza chuma mu dziko la Malawi afotokoza kuti dziko lino litha kupitilira kukumana ndi mavuto a zachuma pokhapokha anthu othandiza ataloweleleraponso, anthu othandizawa sanapereke mbali ya chithandizo cha ndalama yogwiritsira ntchito ku boma chokwanira gawo la 40% kamba ka mchitidwe wa katangale wotchedwa cashgate. Ndalama zopitilira 30 million dollars ndi zomwe zinabedwa kuboma. Anthu ambiri  kuphatikizapo ogwira ntchito m'boma anamangidwa.
mt0: Malawi's monetary authorities say that the country can continue to face economic problems until donors are involved again, donors did not provide 40% of the government's contribution to the economy due to the cashgate scandal. More than 30 million dollars were stolen from the government.

en: The withholding of donor aid has forced Malawi's government to pass what is known as the Zero Aid national budget for the 2014-2015 fiscal year. Analysts, such as Abel Mwanyungwe, an economics lecturer at the Polytechnic College of the University of Malawi, say the drop in spending has hurt the economy.
nya: Kuimitsidwa kwa chithandizo chochokera maiko ena kwakakamiza dziko la malawi kudutsitsa madongosolo a ndalama  a chaka cha 2014-2015 otchedwa Zero Aid national budget. A  Abel Mwanyungwe mmodzi ounguza komanso mphunzitsi wa ndondomeko za chuma ku sukulu ya ukachenjede ya Polytechnic College anati kutsika kwa kagwiritsidwe ntchito ka ndalama  kwasokoneza ndondomeko ya chuma.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know

en: "This has been a bumpy year as we are coming from the Cashgate effects that have quite a major dent on the economys performance. We have seen that in most cases the very delicate and crucial departments and service providers have been affected, in the sense that we dont have enough drugs in the hospitals. In schools, in terms of teachers payments is not in time," said Mwanyungwe.
nya: "Chaka chino chakhala chovuta kwambiri pamene tikuchokera kuzotsatira za Cashgate zimene zaononga kayendetsedwe ka chuma. Malo antchito ambiri komanso anthu obweretsa katundu mdzikoli akhudzidwa monga tilibe mankhwala mzipatala, komanso malipiro a aphunzitsi sakumafika mu nthawi yake, anatero a mwanyungwe.
mt0: "This year has been the most difficult since we came out of the Cashgate scandal which has damaged the economy. Many jobs and businesses in the country have been affected, as well as lack of medicine in hospitals, and teachers' pay has not been paid on time," said a spokesman.

en: Mwanyungwe also links Cashgate to the recent depreciation of Malawis currency, the kwacha, which has resulted in strikes by various government workers demanding higher pay.
nya: A Manyungwe analumikizanso kutsika kwa ndalama ya Malawi ndi kubedwa kwa ndalama mosakadza komwe kunachitika, zomwe zachititsa zionetsero kuchokera kwa  anthu osiyanasiyana ogwira ntchito m'boma pomwe akufuna kukwezedwa malipiro awo.
mt0: The authorities also linked the Malawian currency to the illegal embezzlement of money, which led to protests from various government workers who wanted to get their wages raised.

en: For example, support staff for the judiciary have been on strike for six weeks, seeking a 45 percent pay increase which the government says it cannot afford because it has no money.
nya: Mwachitsanzo anthu othandizira ntchito ku khoti akhala akunyanyala ntchito kwa masabata asanu ndi imodzi pofuna kuti malipiro awo akwezedwe kufika pa 45% zomwe aboma akuti sangakwanitse kutero  chifukwa alibe ndalama.
mt0: For example, lawyers have been taking a six-week strike to raise their wages to 45% which the government says it cannot do because it doesn't have money.

en: Workers at Malawi's Anti-Corruption Bureau went on strike demanding a 70 percent pay raise until the government threatened to forfeit their December salaries if they did not return.
nya: Ogwira ntchito a ku bungwe lothana ndi ziphuphu ananyanyala ntchito pofuna kuti malipiro awo akwezedwe kufika pa 70%  koma a boma anawaopseza kuti salandira malipiro awo a mwezi wa Disembala ngati sabwelera kunchito.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: Mwanyungwe said the government can only avoid further strikes in 2015 if it makes efforts to restore donor confidence in the management of its public finances.
nya: A Manyungwe anati boma litha kupewa kunyanyala ntchito kwinanso mu chaka cha 2015 ngati lingayesetse  kubwezeretsa chikhulupiliro cha anthu othandiza boma pa kagwiritsidwe ntchito ka ndalama za dziko.
mt0: The officials said the government could avoid another strike in 2015 if it tries to rebuild the confidence of the donors in the use of the country's money.

en: "My fear is that if we dont have this donor confidence and donor support coming back to the economy, we may force the government to go into serious local borrowing that would lead to serious repercussions in terms of inflation, in terms of interest rates and this may have a sort of catch-catch lose situation," said Mwanyungwe.
nya: Chomwe ndikuopa ndichakuti ngati athu otithandiza sangatikhulupilirenso, ndikukhalanso opanda chithandizo ku ndondomeko ya chuma chathu, boma litha kukakamizidwa kukabwerekanso ndalama mudziko mommuno zomwe zingadzetse mavuto monga kukwera kwa zinthu, kudzera mu ndalama yaapamwamba yoperekedwa pobweza ndalama. Iyi ndi nyengo yapakatikati, anatero a Manyungwe.
mt0: If our donors don't trust us, and we are again without support for our economic system, the government may be forced to reinvest money in the country which could cause problems like inflation, through the high-level payments provided for repayment. This is the middle phase, said the committee.

en: The donors are, among other things, demanding that the government prosecute all those involved in the scandal and strengthen its financial management system.
nya: Mwa zina zomwe anthu othandizawa akufuna dziko lichite ndi kumanga anthu onse amene anakhudzidwa ndi kuba ndalamazo ndicholinga cholimbitsa njira ya  kagwiritsidwe ntchito ka ndalama.
mt0: Other things that the donors want the world to do is to build a system for funding the entire communities that were affected by the embezzlement of money.

en: Newton Kambala, the president of the Malawi Confederation of Chambers of Commerce and Industry, said the scandal rendered 2014 as "a very bad year for the business sector, because of huge debts that the government owes the private sector."
nya: Mtsogoleri wa bungwe la Malawi Confederation of Chambers of commerce and Industry a Newton kambala, anati kuba ndalama komwe kunachitika mu chaka cha 2014 kunaipitsa nthambi ya anthu ochita malonda chifukwa cha ngongole zochuluka zomwe boma linali nazo kwa anthu a malondawa.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: He warned that if the situation persists, "2015 will be worse."
nya: Iwo anachenjeza kuti ngati zipitilire chonchi, chaka cha 2015 chidzaipa kuposera pano.
mt0: If this continues, 2015 will be worse than this.

en: In his state of the nation address last Saturday, Malawi president Peter Mutharika said his government is doing everything possible to address the problems caused by the Cashgate scandal.
nya: Mtsogoleri wa dziko lino a Peter Mutharika pamene amalankhula ku  mtundu wa a  Malawi loweruka lapitali, anati boma lawo likuyesetsa kuchita mothekera kukonza mavuto amene anadza ndi kuba ndalama.
mt0: The president of the country, Peter Mutharika, speaking to the Malawian people early this morning, said the government is trying to solve the problems caused by the corruption scandal.

en: "My government has strengthened the financial system to make sure that Cashgate never occurs again in Malawi. We have resourced fairly well the law enforcement institutions, including the Anti-Corruption Bureau, so that they do a thorough independent job, prosecute all suspects, and recover the stolen resources where possible," said Mutharika.
nya: Boma langa lakhwimitsa malamulo ku nthambi ya zachuma oonetsetsa kuti kuba ndalama mosakadza kusadzachitikenso mu dziko la Malawi. Tayesetsa kupereka katundu wokwanira wogwilira ntchito mu mabungwe a malamulo,  othetsa katangale kuti agwire ntchito  moyenelera, amange onse akuganiziridwa, komanso kulanda katundu yense anabedwa ngati kuli kotheka," anatero a Mutharika.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Mutharika also said his government is implementing newly-adopted fiscal reforms that seek to grow the countrys economy by 5.5 percent in 2014, up from an estimated 5.0 percent in 2013.
nya: A Mutharika anatinso boma lawo libweretsa njira yatsopano ya kagwiritsidwe ntchito ka ndalama zaboma kamene kakulitse chuma cha dziko kufika pa 5.5% mu chaka  cha 2014 kuchokera pa 5.0 percent mu chaka cha 2013.
mt0: Mutharika also said that his government is bringing a new financial system that will increase the economy to 5.5% in 2014 from 5.0 percent in 2013.

en: Malawi to Conduct Door-to-Door HIV Testing
nya: Dziko la Malawi liyamba kuyeza matenda a edzi khomo ndi khomo.
mt0: Malawi has started to test for tuberculosis every door.

en: Malawians have mixed reactions to government plans to introduce door-to door HIV testing early next year. Supporters say the step is urgently needed because 100 Malawians get infected each day, and an average of 138 die from AIDS daily. Minister of Health Jean Kalirani announced the plans during the recent commemoration of World AIDS Day in the northern district of Karonga.
nya: Amalawi  ali ndi maganizo osiyanasiyana pamene boma likukonzekera kuyambitsa kuyeza matenda a edzi khomo ndi khomo kumayambiliro kwa chaka cha mawa. Omwe ali pa mbuyo pa maganizowa akuti njirayi ikufunika kwambiri chifukwa tsiku lilironse amalawi 100 amatenga matendawa ndipo anthu osachepera 138 amamwalira tsiku lilironse ndi matenda a Edzi. nduna ya zaumoyo a Jean Kalirani analengeza ndondomekoyi pa tsiku lokumbukira matenda a Edzi mu boma la Karonga.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know

en: "We will go in the villages asking for blood samples to check whether that person is HIV positive or not. And those that will be found HIV positive will definitely be given the care they need. And those who are found negative will also be counseled so that they remain negative," said Kalirani.
nya: Tizipita mmidzi kukatenga magazi kwa anthu pofuna kudziwa ngati ali ndi kachiromboko kapena ayi. Amene azipezeka ndi matendawo azipatsidwa chisamaliro choyenera. Ndipo amene alibe azipatsidwa malangizo a mmene angakhalire osatengabe matendawo, anatero a kalirani.
mt0: If we cannot translate, just say you don't know. If we find those with the virus, we will provide proper care. And those who do not have the virus will be given advice on how to avoid the virus, said Kalirani.

en: Kalirani said the campaign will start in mid-March and will aim to reach everyone in the country, including people who are far from health facilities that provide HIV testing and counseling services. She said the campaign is in line with the goal of ending HIV infection by 2030. Malawi's HIV infection rate is currently at 10 percent, a slight drop from three years ago.
nya: A kalirani anati ntchitoyi iyamba mkatikati mwa mwezi wa Malichi ndipo afikira munthu aliyense amene ali ndi kachilombo kapena ayi, kuphatikizapo anthu amene anatalikilana ndi zipatala zazing'ono zomwe zimayeza magazi komanso kupereka uphungu. Iwo anati ntchitoyi ikulingana ndi cholinga chothetsa kutenga kachilombo ka HIV pofikira chaka cha 2030. 10% ndi mlingo wa katengedwe ka matendawa mu dziko lino komwe katsika kuchokera zaka zitatu zapitazo.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: The announcement has raised fears in some Malawians, such as Steven Jailosi, a primary school teacher in rural Blantyre, who feel the campaign will likely infringe upon peoples privacy.
nya: Izi zitalengezedwa, zadzetsa mantha mwa amalawi ena ngati  a Steven Jailosi mphunzitsi wa sukulu ya pulaimale mu mzinda wa Blantyre amene akuona ngati  ntchitoyi idzaika zinsinsi za anthu poyera.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: "I think it is not okay because they will be invading our privacy. HIV testing is supposed to be private. No one is supposed to know that I went for an HIV testing unless I make a choice to tell them," said Jailosi.
nya: Ine ndikuona ngati njirayi siyabwino chifukwa ndizosemphana ndi moyo wathu wa Chinsinsi. Kuyezetsa magazi kumayenera kukhala kobisika. Palibe amene amayenera kudziwa zoti ndinapita kukayezetsa magazi pokhapokha nditapanga chisankho chomuuza, anatero a Jailosi.
mt0: I think this is not a good way to go because it is against our secret life. Blood tests should be kept secret. No one should know that I went to blood tests unless I made the choice to tell him, said Jason.

en: Ester Makonokaya, a secretary in Blantyre, said that although she has been tested already, she feels the door-to-door HIV testing will violate people's privacy.
nya: A Ester Makonokaya,  mlembi mu mzinda wa Blantyre anena kuti ngakhale iwo ayezedwa kale akuona kuti kuyeza magazi khomo ndi khomo ndi kuononga zinsinsi za anthu.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: "Government should instead take the mobile clinics to the villages where people will be able to access them on their own rather than taking testing in their homes, because that might mean that some of the people who are not supposed to know other peoples status will know because, you know, when someone has been tested you show some reactions," said Makonokaya.
nya: Boma likuyenera kutenga zipatala zoyendera mmidzi komwe anthu akakwanitse kuyezetsa pawokha kusiyana ndi kuyezedwa mmakomo mwawo, chifukwa anthu amene samayenera kudziwa zotsatira zawo atha kudziwa chifukwa munthu amene wayezedwa magazi khalidwe lake limasintha, anatero a Makonokaya.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Macpherson Maulana, a journalist in Blantyre and a producer of radio programs on health, told VOA that government would do better to educate Malawians on the need for HIV testing so that people will go for tests on their own "without being pushed."
nya: A Macpherson Maulana, mtolankhani komanso wokonza ma pologalamu a zaumoyo  mu mzinda wa Blantyre anauza wailesi ya VOA kuti boma likuyenera kuphunzitsa anthu ubwino woyezetsa magatsi ndicholinga choti anthu akayezetse pawokha mosakakamizidwa.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: "I fear it could end up into fights. You see it happened in Liberia recently where people who were coming to help people suspected to have contracted Ebola were even killed. So, civic education is the most important element for people to be encouraged to come out for testing voluntarily," said Maulana.
nya: Ndikuopa kuti izi zitha kuyambitsa kumenyana. Ku dziko la Liberia pompano anthu amene anapita kukathandiza anthu owaganizira kuti anali ndi matenda a Ebola anaphedwa. Choncho anthuwa akuyenera kuwaphunzitsa kuti alimbikitsidwe kukayezetsa mwakufuna kwawo,  anatero a Maulana.
mt0: I'm afraid that this could cause fighting. In Liberia, those who went to help people who suspected to have Ebola have been killed. So they should be taught to be encouraged to do their own tests, said Maulana.

en: However, HIV/AIDS counselor David Odali, whose NGO Umunthu Foundation runs HIV-related projects, insisted privacy will be protected.
nya: Mlangizi wa matenda a HIV a David Odali omwe ali ndi bungwe lawo logwira ntchito zokhudzana ndi matenda a Edzi lotchedwa Umunthu Foundation anatsimikiza kuti zinsinsi za anthu ndi zotetezedwa.

en: "Confidentiality will be upheld. Lets consider the household setup. I think the first thing would be to provide group counseling to members of that family. [Of course] people can be tested while others are watching, but when it comes to disclosing the results, a counselor is supposed to disclose that results to each and every individual separately," said Odali.
nya: Zinsinsi za anthu zidzasungidwa, tikatengera mmene nyumba imakhalira, chinthu choyambilira ndi kulangiza anthu a nyumba yonse pamodzi. Kenako aliyense atha kuyezedwa pomwepo aliyense akuona koma popereka zotsatira za magazi mlangiziyo akuyenera kumuuza munthu aliyense payekha, anatero a Odali.

en: Odali said it will be up to the person who has been tested to disclose his or her status.
nya: A Odali anati zili kwa munthu yemwe wayezedwa kuulula zotsatira za magazi ake.

en: In 2006, the charity Development Aid from People to People conducted door-to-door HIV testing in the district of Thyolo and Blantyre, reaching 400,000 people. The organization says it worked well.
nya: Mu chaka cha 2006 a Bungwe lothandiza anthu la Charity Development Aid from people to people anayeza magazi khomo ndi khomo anthu okwanira 400,000 mu maboma a Blantyre ndi Thyolo ndipo anati zinayenda bwino.
mt0: In 2006 the Charity Development Aid from people to people tested 400,000 people in the cities of Blantyre and Thyolo and said it was a success.

en: Water Crisis Raises Fears of Waterborne Disease in Malawi
nya: Kusowa kwa  madzi kwabweretsa mantha kwa Malawi odzetsa matenda amene amayamba ndi madzi opanda ukhondo.
mt0: Water shortages have caused fears in Malawi about a disease that starts with unclean water.

en: Malawians in the country's commercial capital, Blantyre, usually rely on tap water. But for the past five months, the taps have often run dry, forcing residents to draw water from unprotected sources like rivers and wells, while work is being done at the city main pumping station.The risk of contracting water-borne diseases is rising.
nya: A Malawi okhala mu mzinda wa malonda wa  Blantyre amadalira madzi a pa mpopi. Koma miyezi isanu yapitayi, mipopi yakhala youma zomwe zimakakamiza anthu kukatunga madzi ku zitsime ndi mitsinje komwe madzi ake siotetezedwa, izi zikuchitika pamene akukuakulu amu mzinda akupopa madzi kuchokera ku mgodi wawo. Njira yotengera matenda a madzi opanda ukhondo ikuchulukirabe.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: In Blantyre and surrounding areas, residents have spent five days without tap water.
nya: Anthu a boma la Blantyre ndi malo ozungulira akhala masiku asanu opanda madzi ochokera pa mpopi.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: Women, who by Malawi tradition are responsible for household tasks, complain of the risks they face when fetching water from rivers far from residential areas.
nya: Azimayi amene pachikhalidwe amagwira ntchito za mnyumba adandaula pa zomwe akukumanazo pamene akumakatunga madzi ku mitsinje yakutali kuchokera kwawo.
mt0: Return only if you cannot translate. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: Rhoda Milanzi, a housewife and mother of three, tells VOA the journeys through bushy footpaths are risky. "We wake up every day 2 a.m., sometimes 1 a.m., to go and collect water. There are so many risks. You see, sometimes we would meet witches, snakes on the way," she says, "even hyenas have been chasing us."
nya: A Rhoda Milanzi mzimayi wa ana atatu yemwe amakhala pakhomo, wauza wailesi ya VOA mmene maulendo odutsa mutchire amakhalira oopsa. "Timadzuka 2 koloko kapena 1 koloko mammawa kukatunga madzi. Pamakhala zoopsa zambiri.. Nthawi zina timakumana ndi afiti, njoka munjira, komanso afisi amatithamangitsa," iwo anatero.
mt0: If you can't translate, just say you don't know.

en: Milanzi says to ease the burden of carrying water home for bathing, women prefer to bathe in the river. But she says they have been disturbed by youths who hide in the nearby bush.
nya: A Milanzi anati pochepetsa ntchito yosenza madzi osamba kupita nawo kwawo, azimayi amasankha kusamba mu mtsinjewo. Koma anati amasokonezedwa ndi achinyamata omwe amabisala mu tchire lapafupi.
mt0: According to Milanzi, because of the reduction of the cost of making soap for their homes, women choose to bathe in the river. However, they say they are disturbed by young people who are hiding in the nearby woods.

en: "These youths of today would come there and hide somewhere to see us naked. This has been a major embarrassment. In fact we complained to the chiefs about it.
nya: "Achinyamata amasiku anowa amabwera kubisala  ndikumatisuzumila tili amaliseche. Zimatichititsa manyazi kwambiri ndipo tinakadandaulako kwa amfumu.
mt0: "These young people come to hide and look at us as naked. It makes us very ashamed and we complained to the kings.

en: They punished some of them, but you know they would sometimes climb trees just to look at older women like us taking a bath," she explains.
nya: Ena  mwa iwo analandira chilango , komabe nthawi zina amakwera mmitengo ndicholinga choonera azimayi akuluakulu ngati ife tikamasamba, iwo anafotokoza.
mt0: Some of them were sentenced , but sometimes they climbed the stairs to see older women as we walked, they explained.

en: The water problem also has affected the delivery of health services.
nya: Vuto la madzili lakhudza kagwiridwe ntchito ka zaumoyo
mt0: The water problem affects health care. If you can't translate it, just say you don't know.

en: Three weeks ago, authorities at Queen Elizabeth Central Hospital in Blantyre confirmed that they had suspended surgical operations due to water scarcity.
nya: Masabata atatu apitawo akuluakulu a chipatala  cha Queens mu mzinda wa Blantyre anatsimikiza kuti aimitsa kuchita ma opaleshoni kamba ka kusowa kwa madzi.
mt0: Three weeks later, the Queens Hospital in Blantyre confirmed that they had stopped operations because of a water shortage.

en: Health rights campaigners warn of the possible outbreak of waterborne diseases, especially in densely populated areas, if the situation is left unresolved.
nya: Anthu omenyera ufulu wa zaumoyo achenjeza  anthu zokhudza matenda oyamba ndi madzi opanda ukhondo makamaka mmadera omwe muli anthu ochuluka ngati zinthu sizisintha.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Officials at the Blantyre Water Board attribute the problem largely to an ongoing European Union-funded project that seeks to install new pumping machines at Walkers Ferry, the main pumping station.  Priscilla Mateyu, the spokesperson for the Blantyre Water Board, says the project is expected to increase water production capacity to 105,000 cubic meters per day from the current daily production of 78,000 cubic meters.
nya: Ogwira ntchito ku Bungwe loona za madzi la Blantyre waterboard ati vutoli likuchokera ku ntchito yoika makina atsopano opopera madzi ku Walkers Ferry  mothandizidwa ndi ndalama zochokera ku European Union. Mneneri wa Blantyre water board anati ntchitoyi ikuyenera kuchulutsa kapangidwe ka madzi kufika pa ma mita a madzi okwana 105,000 patsiku kuchokera pa 78,000 kwapano.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: "January is when the project is finishing. But for the new machines and everything else to start working properly, we have to wait until March [2015]. That's when we expect the levels would increase and also production capacity improving to least what we expect it to be," Mateyu said.
nya: Ntchitoyi imalizika mwezi wa Januwale. Pakadali pano kuti makinawa ayambe kugwira ntchito bwinobwino tikuyenera kudikira mwezi wa Malichi (2015). Apa ndipamene tikuyembekeza kuti mlingo wa madzi uchuluka komanso madziwo azipezeka ambiri kusiyana ndi mmene ziliri pano,  iwo anafotokoza.
mt0: The project is scheduled to be completed in January. Currently, we must wait until March 2015 to start operating properly. This is when we expect the flow of water to be higher and the water to be available more than what it is now, they said.

en: The local consumer rights watchdog, the Consumers Association of Malawi, had been planning to hold vigils at the water board until the water supply was normalized, but the board asked protesters to hold off, promising to distribute water to residents through mobile water tanks.  The consumer rights group has given the water board two weeks to fulfill its commitment before proceeding with the protests.
nya: Bungwe la Consumers Association of Malawi lomwe limayang'anira anthu ogula zinthu mmisika, lakhala likukonzekera m'bindikiro ku Waterboard pofikila madzi atayambanso kutuluka bwinobwino, koma ogwira ntchito ku Waterboard anawauza anthuwa kuti aime kaye, powalonjeza kuti iwo akhala akupereka madzi mmakomo mwa anthu kudzera mu ma tanki awo. A Bungweli apereka masabata awiri kwa a Waterboard kuti akwanilitse lonjezo lawo asanapitilire ndi zionetsero zawo.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know. The Consumers Association of Malawi has been preparing a protest at Waterboard to get water back to the public, but Waterboard staff told the protesters to wait, saying they were going to provide water to the public through their tanks. The Consumers Association of Malawi gave Waterboard two weeks to fulfill their promise before they started their protests.

en: Malawi President Under Fire for Giving Money to Journalists
nya: Mtsogoleri wa dziko la Malawi ali pa moto kamba kopereka ndalama kwa atolankhani.
mt0: Return only if you can't translate. If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: Malawi President Peter Mutharika is under fire for giving envelopes containing $125 to more than 80 media people at a dinner he hosted last month in Blantyre. The editor of the privately owned Times Television said reporters were told the envelopes contained the presidents plans for the media - which has been critical of the governments economic performance.
nya: Mtsogoleri wa dziko la Malawi a Peter Mutharika ali pa moto popereka ndalama zokwa 125 dolazi kwa ogwira ntchito nyumba zofalitsa nkhani okwana makumi asanu ndi atatu pa mgoneri omwe anachititsa mu mzinda wa Blantyre mwezi watha. Wokonza nkhani wa wailesi ya  kanema ya TImes Television anati atolankhaniwo anauzidwa kuti muma envelopuwo  munali ma pulani a mtsogoleriyo okhudza nyumba zofalitsa nkhani zomwe zakhala zikuvutitsa kayendetsedwe cha chuma cha boma.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know

en: In his column published in Malawis Sunday Times newspaper, editor Grecian Tukula said he was not sure why the money was given to journalists at the state dinner.
nya: Mu tsamba lawo lomwe analemba Lamulungu mu nyuzi ya Sunday Times a Gretian Tukula anati iwo sakudziwa chifukwa chenicheni chomwe atolankhani anawapatsira ndalamayo ku mgonero wa bomawo.
mt0: In a Sunday Times article published on Thursday, Gretian Tukula said that they don't know the exact reason why the press contributed to their election campaign.

en: Tukula said he initially decided to return the money but reversed the decision to avoid "creating a scene."
nya: A Tukula anati analingalira zokabweza ndalamayo koma anabweza chiganizo chawo posafuna kuchititsa mpungwepungwe.
mt0: The elder said he considered taking back the money but rejected his proposal without causing any trouble.

en: But the editor for the Weekend Nation newspaper, George Kasakula, told VOA that he returned the money right away.
nya: Koma mlembi wa nyuzipepala ya Weekend Nation  a George Kasakula anauza wailesi ya VOA kuti iwo anabweza ndalamayo nthawi yomweyo.
mt0: But the editor of the Weekend Nation, George Kasakula, told VOA that they had returned the money right away.

en: "I just felt it was not right for me to receive the money, so I returned it. My understanding is that if someone invites me to a workshop, its their duty to ensure that they feed me, they accommodate me and they transport me. But in this case, I didnt see why I should get that allowance because I didnt spend anything to go to Sanjika [Palace]," said Kasakula.
nya: Ine ndinaona kuti sikunali koyenera kulandira ndalamayo, choncho ndinaibweza. Ine ndimadziwa kuti ndikaitanidwa kogwira ntchito kwina ndi udindo wawo kundidyetsa, kundipatsa malo ogona komanso mayendedwe. Koma ndi mmene zinaliri, sindinaone chifukwa chopatsilidwa ndalama poti sindinagwiritse  ntchito ndalama iliyonse kupita ku Sanjika, anatero a Kasakula.
mt0: I thought it was unnecessary to get the money, so I turned it back. I know that if I was called to work elsewhere, it would be their duty to provide me with food, accommodation and transport. But as it was, I didn't see a reason to get the money because I didn't use any money to go to Sanjika, said Kasakula.

en: The issue has attracted more public attention after privately owned Capital Radio aired a story questioning the meaning of the cash handouts from the president.
nya: Nkhaniyi yachititsa chidwi chachikulu kwa anthu pamene  wailesi yoima payokha ya Capital Radio inaulutsa nkhani yofunsa tanthauzo la ndalama zinagawidwazi kuchokera kwa mtsogoleri wadzikoyu.
mt0: The story drew a lot of attention when the closed-air radio station Capital Radio asked the president what the money was worth.

en: "As Capital FM we serve the interest of the public. This issue has been all over the social media, and even we as a media are implicated [we believe] it is paramount that we follow up and get to the bottom of the matter," said Steven Dakalira, the head of news and current affairs at Capital Radio.
nya: Ife a wailesi ya Capital Radio timagwira ntchito  mokomera dziko. Nkhaniyi ili pa masamba onse ofalitsa nkhani, komanso ife ofalitsa nkhani takhudzidwa nawo, choncho ndikoyenera kutsatira nkhaniyi moyenera, anatero a Steve Dakalira, mkulu wa nkhani ku wailesi ya Capital radio.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know We work for the world. The story is on all media channels, and we journalists are affected, so it is important to follow the story very carefully, said Steve Dakalira, the news editor at Capital Radio.

en: In his column in the Nyasa Times, Malawi professor of law Danwood Mzikenge Chirwa said what President Mutharika did by giving money handouts to journalists at a news event was tantamount to bribery. He has called on Mutharika to resign or face impeachment proceedings.
nya: A Danwood Mzikenge Chirwa mphunzitsi wa zamalamulo; mu tsamba lawo ya nyuzipepala ya Nyasa Times anati zomwe mtsogoleri wa dziko lino a Mutharika  popereka ndalama kwa atolankhani ku msonkhano womwe anachititsa kukufanana ndi mchitidwe wa katangale. Iwo auza a Mutharika kuti atule pansi udindo wawo kapena akonzekere kuchotsedwa pa mpando wawo.

en: Local civil society groups said that "by attempting to bribe the journalists" Mutharika subjected his leadership style to disrepute.

en: Famine in Southern Africa Worse Than Predicted - 2002-07-24

en: The United Nations World Food Program says the famine in southern Africa is even worse than predicted. WFP officials are warning that 13 million people in six countries: Malawi, Zambia, Lesotho, Zimbabwe, Swaziland and Mozambique are in danger of starvation if they do not get food aid.
nya: Mgwirizano wa dziko lonse wokhudza chakudya ( United Nations World Food Program) wati chilala ku mmwera  kwa Afilika chaipiraipira kusiyana ndi mmene amaganizira. Akuluakulu a bungwe la WFP achenjeza  kuti anthu okwana 13 million mmaiko a Malawi, Zambia, Lesotho, Swazilandi ndi Mozambique  ali pa chiopsezo ngati salandira thandizo la chakudya.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: World Food Program officials say they need one million tons of food to alleviate hunger in southern Africa, but they are not confident they will get it. In an appeal to the international community at the beginning of July, WFP officials asked for more than $0.5 billion to buy food. So far they have received only 20 percent of that. WFP's director for the southern Africa region, Judith Lewis, says the situation is getting desperate. "The window of opportunity to avert what could be a major humanitarian crisis is closing," she said. "We need more assistance now. We need food on the high seas now, or we need cash to buy commodities that are still available in southern Africa, so we can avert this major, major crisis."
nya: Akuluakulu a World Food program ati akufunika  ma tani 1 million a chakudya kuti achepetse njala ku mmwera kwa Afilika, koma iwo alibe chikhulupiliro kwenikweni kuti atha kuchipeza. Pempho lomwe anapempha ku gulu lapadziko lonse lapansi kumayambiliro kwa mwezi wa Julayi, akuluakulu a  WFP anapempha ndalama zopitilira 0.5 biliyoni zogulira chakudya. Koma pakadali pano iwo alandira gawo la 20 pelesenti la ndalamayo. Wotsogolera gulu la WFP ku mmwera kwa Afilika a Judith Lewis, anati vutoli likupita kuwasowetsa chiyembekezo. "Mwayi omwe unapezeka  othetsera  vuto lalikululi ukutsekedwa," iwo anatero. "Tikufuna chithandizo chochuluka tsopano. Tikufuna chakudya chochuluka kapena ndalama zoti tigulire katundu yemwe adakapezeka kummwera kwa Afilika kuti tichepetse vuto lalikululi.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Currently, the WFP is assisting six million of the most vulnerable people in the six most severely affected countries. About half of these people are in Zimbabwe. The agency says it is sure the number of people needing its help will rise.

en: The World Health Organization notes southern Africa, in addition to having the highest prevalence of HIV/AIDS in the world, also has the world's highest chronic malnutrition rates. It predicts about 300,000 people could die over the next six months from diseases related to malnutrition.
nya: Bungwe loona zaumoyo dziko lonse lapansi la World Health Organisation lati maiko a  kummwera kwa Afilika  poonjezerapo kukhala ndi anthu ochuluka a matenda a Edzi padziko lonse, lilinso ndi chiwelengelo chochuluka cha anthu osoya zakudya  mthupi. iwo anati anthu 300,000 atha kufa ndi matenda osowa chakudyawa pa miyezi isanu ndi umodzi ikubwerayi.

The World Health Organisation says the eastern African countries are threatened with a higher number of cases of Ebola worldwide, and a higher number of bodies with a lack of food. They say that 300,000 people could die of food shortages in the next six months.

en: Ms. Lewis says the dying has already begun. "We are seeing people moving from their villages," she said. "If they know there is going to be a food distribution, they immediately go there. The problem is we do not even have enough food to feed the people who are on the rolls, let alone add food for other people in the areas. Is there a potential to become chaotic? Yes. "
nya: Mai Lewis anati anthu ayamba kale kufa. "anthu akumasamuka mmidzi mwawo, kupita ku malo omwe amvetsedwa kuti kuli chakudya. Vuto ndilakuti tilibe chakudya chokwanira choti tingawadyetse anthu omwe ali pa ndandandawa komanso omwe ali mmadera ena. Kodi pali kuthekera koti zitha kubweretsa chipwirikiti ? eya."

The problem is that we don't have enough food to feed the people on the list and the people in other areas. Is there any possibility that this can bring a crisis? Yes."

en: WFP'S Judith Lewis says at this time of year the agency is usually planning how to get food supplies into the region before the rainy season hits in October. But she says since the WFP is already having difficulty meeting its present targets, it can't even begin to plan for future food deliveries.

mt0: Mr. Chiretien is the head of the group of six countries with a large manufacturing base , including Russia . He is visiting Africa to discuss the expansion of the African Peninsula called NEPAD .

en: Though "everybody's got the right to demonstrate," there have "been a lot of insinuations and campaigns of violence," Sibusiso B. Moyo told VOA in an interview. Citing public safety, he endorsed a Zimbabwe court's ruling hours earlier to uphold a police ban on a protest organized by the opposition Movement for Democratic Change (MDC) alliance.

Poitanitsa chitetezo cha dziko, iwo anavomera nthawi yogamula milandi ku khoti la ku ZImbabwe msanga kuti akalimbikitse kuletsa komwe apolisi akuchita pa zionetsero zomwe a chipani chotsutsa boma cha MDC akonza.

en: Alliance leaders are pressing President Emmerson Mnangagwa and the ruling ZANU-PF party for a role in a transitional government. They had organized a demonstration Monday in Bulawayo, the country's second-largest city, but police authorities banned it hours before its intended start. Two other opposition demonstrations still are planned this week: for the central city of Gweru on Tuesday and the southeastern city of Masvingo on Wednesday.

Zionetsero zina zakonzedwa sabata yamawa, ku mzinda wa pakati wa Gweru lLachiwiri komanso kummwera chakummawa kwa mzinda wa Masvingo Lachitatu.

en: Police also had pre-emptively banned a demonstration in Harare last Friday, a decision upheld by a Zimbabwe court. Hundreds of MDC supporters ignored the ban, leading to clashes between civilians and police. Video and photographs showed police hitting and kicking some demonstrators among actions that drew complaints of excessive force from civil and human rights groups, including the United Nations human rights office.

Makanema ndi zithunzi zinaonetsa Apolisiwo akumenya anthu ochita zionetselo zomwe zinabweretsa madandaulo kuchoka ku mabungwe oona za ufulu wa anthu, kuphatikizapo ofesi ya dziko lonse lapansi ya United Nations.

en: The southern African country of nearly 16 million is experiencing its worst financial crisis since 2008, beset by hyperinflation and the fallout of decades of corruption. en: Catherine Eden, a lawyer for the Tanzania Human Rights Defenders Coalition, says the incident stemmed from a misunderstanding. South African delegates to the 15-nation conference, she said, wanted to hold a short commemoration of the seventh anniversary of South Africa's deadly Marikana mine massacre on Aug. 16. Thirty-four striking miners were killed by police in the deadliest security incident since the end of apartheid in 1994.

en: The surge in food prices was the biggest driver behind consumer inflation in Egypt, it rose by 8.8% in February – the sharpest increase in nearly three years, according to the state statistics agency, CAPMAS.

en: Cudjoe said it was crucial for governments and regional bodies such as the African Union to build defenses to cushion consumers in times of economic uncertainty.
nya: A Cudjoe anati zinali zovuta kwa maboma  ndi madera ngati a African Union kuti apange njira zodzitetezera podzathandizira anthu ogula zinthu mu nyengo ya kusatsimikizika kwa chuma.
mt0: Cudjoe said it was difficult for governments and organizations such as the African Union to establish safety measures to help consumers in the financial uncertainty.

en: "Even if it means building defenses in terms of the provision of food," said Cudjoe, adding, "I could imagine Nigeria, if it had had its way, it could be selling foodstuff to most countries at reduced rates by now."
nya: Ngakhale kutamangidwa chitetezo  mu njira yopeleka chakudya," anatero a Cudjoe poonjezera, "Ndikulingalira dziko la Nigeria, linakakhala ndi njira yake bwezi likugulitsa chakudya  ku maiko ambiri motsika mtengo panopa."
mt0: "Although there is a safety concern in the distribution of food," Cudjoe added, "I think Nigeria, if it had its own system, would have been able to sell food to many countries at a lower price."

en: "There must be that urgency of building for themselves defenses, funds that would make us sustain ourselves -- at least to prevent us from being completely annihilated by these uncertainties in the world."
nya: "Pakuyenera kukhala changu chodzimangira chitetezo, ndalama zoti zitha kutisunga-zotipewetsa kuwonongeka ku kusatsimikizidwa kwa  zinthu zochitika pa dzilo lonse.
mt0: "There must be a quick planning of security, savings that can protect us from the uncertainty of global events.

en: Chibamba Kanyama, an economist in the Zambian capital of Lusaka, said suspending fuel taxes would be "the most ideal thing to do now under the circumstances" to cushion consumers and industries.
nya: A Chibamba kanyama, oona zachuma mu mzinda wa Lusaka ku Zambia, anati kuchotsa misonkho ya mafuta chitha kukhala chinthu choyenera kuchita panopa ndi nyengoyi poteteza anthu ogula ndi mafakitale.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: "African governments must find a way of responding," he said. 'It is a choice of whether to reduce taxes to lower the prices or to maintain the price levels and use the revenues to subsidize the most vulnerable in society."
nya: "Maiko a dera la Afilika akuyenera kupeza  njira yolowelerapo," iwo anatero.  Ali ndi chisankho chotsitsa misonkho kuti atsitse mitengo yazinthu kapena kusiya mitengo yomweyo ndi kugwiritsa ntchito ndalama za boma kuti atsitse mitengo kwa anthu ofuna chithandizo.
mt0: "The African countries must find a way to respond," they said. They have the choice of lowering taxes to reduce prices of goods or keeping the same prices and using government money to reduce prices for those who need help.

en: But Kanyama also suggested that the geopolitical crisis involving Russia and Ukraine – both big grain exporters to Africa – may create opportunities for African producers.
nya: Koma a Kanyama anapereka maganizo oti zovuta za maiko zomwe zikuchitika pakati pa Russia ndi Ukraine amene ali maiko ogulitsa katundu ku Afilika, zitha kupereka mwayi ochuluka  kwa opanga zinthu zosiyanasiyana ku Afilika.
mt0: But the animals suggested that the tensions between Russia and Ukraine, which are both a supply country to the African market, could provide a lot of opportunities for various manufacturers in the African market.

en: "Supply countries like South Africa, with robust and highly mechanized systems, may find a window of exporting [commodities] like wheat and other products to fill the gaps left by Russia and Ukraine," Kanyama said.
nya: Maiko ogulitsa zinthu ngati South Africa, amene ali ndi machitidwe amakina amphamvu, atha kupeza mwayi wotumiza kunja zithu ngati  tirigu, ndi zina zomwe asiya mpata a maiko a Russia ndi Ukraine," anatero a Kanyama.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know. Companies like South Africa, which has strong markets, can get the chance to export things like rice, and other things that leave Russia and Ukraine out," said Kanama.

en: Kanyama also said support by the international community – for instance, in the form of debt relief for some African nations – is welcome.

en: WHO Says Africa's COVID Vaccinations Rose by 15% in February
nya: Bungwe la WHO lati Katemera wa COVID ku africa anakwera ndi anthu 15 pa anthu 100 ena alionse(15%) mu mwezi wa February
mt0: If you can't translate, just say you don't know. The World Health Organization says the infection rate of COVID-19 in Africa rose by 15 per 100 (15%) in February.

en: The World Health Organization says Africas COVID-19 vaccinations rose by 15% between January and February, as several countries embarked on mass inoculation drives to expand coverage and protect populations from the pandemic.
nya: Bungwe la World Health Organisation lati katemera wa COVID 19 ku Africa anakwera ndi anthu 15 pa anthu 100 alionse (15%) pakati pa mwezi wa January ndi February
mt0: If you can't translate, just say you don't know. The World Health Organisation says the infection rate of COVID-19 in Africa rose by 15 per 100 (15%) between January and February.

en: Zimbabwes government says it is launching a "national vaccination blitz" targeting those who have not yet been vaccinated in a country where resistance to the shots has been an issue since the program started last year. The drive come amid government concern over rising COVID-19 cases.  Dr. Matshidiso Moeti, WHO regional director for Africa, said in a statement that the increase in COVID-19 vaccinations on the continent was driven mainly by campaigns in populous countries, including the Democratic Republic of Congo, Ethiopia, Kenya, and Nigeria.
nya: Boma la Zimbabwe likukhazikitsa ntchito yolimbikitsa katemera m'dziko lawo lonse "National vaccination blitz" yomwe cholinga chake n'cholimbikitsa omwe sanabayitse katemera m'dzikoli lomwe vuto lokana kubayitsa linali lalikulu chiyambireni ntchitoyi chaka chatha. Ntchitoyi ikulimbikitsidwa malingana ndi kukwera kwa chiwerengero cha anthu opezeka ndi kachilombo ka COVID 19. Dr. Matshidiso Moeti omwe ndi  regional director wa WHO ku Africa mu mawu ake anati kukwera kwa kubayitsa kwa katemera wa COVID-19 kunalimbikitsidwa makamaka chifukwa cha ntchito zofalitsa uthengawu mu mayiko omwe ali ndi chiwerengero cha anthu ambili kumbaphatikizirapo mayiko a Congo, Ethiopia, Kenya ndi Nigeria
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know

en: Dr. Thierno Balde, the WHO Africa regional COVID-19 incident manager, he says the continent must remain vigilant.
nya: Dr. Thierno Balde, omwe ndi regional COVID-19 incident manager wa WHO ku Africa wati anthu a mu kontinentiyi akhalebe atcheru
mt0: Dr. Thierno Balde, the regional COVID-19 incident manager of the WHO in Africa, said that people in the continent should be aware of the spread of the virus.

en: "We have seen what is happening around, in China, and the risk of also having new imitations, new variants still possible. We really need to continue to safeguard our population by taking the vaccine by not relaxing totally. The situation might change. So we really need to continue adapting some of these social measures and also to get vaccination," Balde said.
nya: "Taona zomwe zikuchitika ku China, komanso kuopsa kokhala ndi machitidwe ena ofananizidwa ndi kachilomboka, mitundu ina ya kachilomboka yomwe ili ndi kuthekera kwakupezeka
mt0: We have seen what is happening in China, and the danger of having other infections associated with the virus, some types of the virus that have the potential to be found.

en: The WHO said to boost African COVID-19 vaccine acceptance, it and other organizations were supporting mass vaccination drives in at least 10 priority countries to reach 100 million people by the end of next month.
nya: WHO inati pofuna kuthandizira kuvomerezedwa kwa kamtemera wa COVID 19, ilo komanso ma bungwe ena amathandizira kubayitsa kwa namtindi wa anthu mu mayiko osankhidwa osachepera 10 ndi cholinga chofikira anthu 100 miliyoni pakutha pa mwezi wa mawa
mt0: WHO said that in order to help promote the introduction of the COVID-19 vaccine, it and other organizations are helping to reduce the number of cases in 10 selected countries with the goal of reaching 100 million people by the end of the month tomorrow.

en: Nqobizitha Mangaliso Ndlovu, Zimbabwes acting information minister, said his country would not be left behind.
nya: Nqobizitha Mangaliso Ndlovu amene akugwilizira mpando wa nduna ya zofalitsa nkhani anatidziko lake silitsalira pa mbuyo

en: "Regarding the vaccination program, as of 15 March, 2022, a total of 159,628 third doses have been administered to date. The national vaccination blitz campaign will kick off on Monday, 21 March, 2022, and [the] government is urging those that have not yet been vaccinated to take advantage of this exercise to do so," Ndlovu said.
nya: "pokhadzana ndi ndondomeko ya kubaya katemera, pochokera pa 15 March 2022 kufikira tsiku la lero, anthu okwana 159, 628 analandira kubayitsa kwa chitatu kwa katemerayu. Ntchito yakubayitsa katemera mu dziko lonse wotchedwa 'National vaccination blitz' uyamba pa 21 March 2022 ndipo boma likulimbikitsa omwe sanabayitse kuti atengerepo mwayi pa ntchitoyi" anatero Ndlovu
mt0: If you can't translate, just say you don't know "according to the vaccination scheme, from 15 March 2022 to today, a total of 159,628 people received the third vaccination of the vaccine. The national vaccination blitz will start on 21 March 2022 and the government is urging those who did not receive the vaccination to take part in the blitz."

en: A number of Zimbabweans have refused vaccination, saying they do not trust the mainly donated Chinese-made Sinopharm and Sinovac vaccines. The country has lately recorded a rise in new infections – now cumulatively at 244,012 with 5,418 deaths, according to the Johns Hopkins University, which is tracking the global outbreak.
nya: Mzika zambili za Zimbabwe zakana kulandira katemerayu pachifukwa chakuti iwo sakumuona bwino katemera yemwe anapatsidwa kwa iwo yemwe anapangidwa ku China, sinopharm ndi Sinova. Kutengera zotsatila zomwe zinapezedwa ndiJohns Hopkins University pakatipa, omwe akupanga namlondora wa matenda obuka pa dziko lonse, chiwelengero cha odwala mtundu wa tsopano wa COVID 19 mu dzikoli chakwera kufikira 244,012 kuphatikizira imfa za anthu 5,418.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know

en: Dr. Cleophas Chimbetete, president of Zimbabwe College of Public Health Physicians, attributes that to the recent lifting of restrictive measures, such as lockdowns. He says, however, it is not time to panic, just to enforce WHO protocols, such masking and social distancing.
nya: Dr. Cleophas Chimbetete omwe ndi wamkulu wa Zimbabwe College of Public Health Physicians wati izi zili choncho kamba ka kuchotsa kwa njira zocheptsera kafalikira kwa matendawa monga kutseka kwa zipata zolowera m'dzikolo. Iye wati, komabe,sikoyenera kuti anthu akhale ndi mantha koma kulimbikitsa kutsatira njira za WHO monga kuvala zotchinga kukwama ndi kukhala motalikilana.
mt0: Dr. Cleophas Chimbete, a head of Zimbabwe College of Public Health Physicians, said this is due to the removal of barriers to prevent the spread of the disease, such as the closure of the borders. He said, however, it is not necessary to panic but to encourage people to follow WHO guidelines such as wearing a face mask and being socially aware.

en: "After relaxing measures, it is expected that cases will slightly go up. But I also think that it is too early to make any meaningful conclusions, I think it is just an opportunity for us to strengthen our preventative measures and continue highlighting to the rest of the population that COVID is still with us. The good news, though, is that severe cases have not gone up. What we need to do is to continue to get vaccinated and what is important is that the government should – as it is doing – is monitor these numbers. There is no cause for alarm or cause for us to introduce new measures," Chimbetete said.
nya: "chifukwa chakukhwefura njira zopwera, kukuyembekezedwa kuti chiwelengero cha odwala chikwera pang'ono. Koma ndikuganiza kuti sitingaphere mkota mwamsanga ngati pakali pano. Ndikuona kuti ndi mwayi wathu kuti tilimbitse njira zopewera komanso kutsindika kwa mzika zathu kuti COVID 19 tikanali naye. Komabe nkhani yabwino ndi yakuti matenda odwala kwambili sakukwera chiwerengero. Chomwe tikufunika kuchita ndi kupitiliza kulandira katemera komanso boma lipitilize kuyang'anira chiwerengero monga mowe likuchitira. Palibepo chobweretsa mantha komanso chotipangitsa kuoeza njira zina," anatero Chimbetete.
mt0: "Because of the restrictions, the numbers are expected to rise a little. But I think we can't kill the virus as quickly as we can. I think it's our opportunity to strengthen the restrictions and to encourage our citizens to remember that COVID-19 was already present. The good news is that the number of cases is not rising. What we need to do is continue to get vaccinated and the government should use the same controls as the economy does," said Chubert.

en: Zimbabwe had a target of vaccinating at least 10 million people by the end of last year, a figure that some say was difficult to reach given the scarcity of resources and hesitance. It has yet to announce when it plans to achieve herd immunity.
nya: Boma la Zimbabwe limafuna kupeleka katemera jwa anthu osachepera 10 million pakutha kwa chaka chatha, chiwerengero chomwe ena mati n'chovuta kuchikwanilitsa potengera kusowa kwa zipangizo zofunikira komanso kuzengereza. Likuyembekezedwa kuti lilengeze chikonzero chake kuti ikwanilitse kupima kapena kusakhudzika ndi matendawa.

en: Finland has been named the world's happiest country for the fifth year running, in an annual U.N.-sponsored index that again ranked Afghanistan as the unhappiest, followed closely by Lebanon.

en: Serbia, Bulgaria and Romania recorded the biggest boosts in wellbeing. The largest falls in the World Happiness table, released on Friday, came in Lebanon, Venezuela and Afghanistan.

en: War-traumatized Afghanistan, already bottom of the table, has seen its humanitarian crisis deepen since the Taliban took power again last August.  U.N. agency UNICEF estimates one million children under five could die of hunger this winter if not aided.
nya: Afghanistan, dziko lomwe lazunzika ndi nkhondo lomwe lili kale pansi pa mndandanda, zaonekera kulowa pansi kwakukulu kwa kakhalidwe kabwino kapena thanzi la anthu awo kuchokela nthawi yomwe matalibani anatenganso ulamuliro kachikena mu August wapitayu. U.N. agency UNICEF anayelekezera kuti ana osapyora zaka zisanu okwana 1 miliyoni akanatha kufa ndi njala mnyengo yozizirayi akanapanda kuthandizidwa.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know Afghanistan, a country that has been under a military occupation since August, has seen a sharp decline in its overall health and well-being since the temporary resumption of authority by the Taliban in August. The United Nations' agency UNICEF estimated that 1 million children under the age of five could die of hunger in the winter if they were not supported.

en: "This (index) presents a stark reminder of the material and immaterial damage that war does to its many victims," co-author Jan-Emmanuel De Neve said. The World Happiness Report, now in its 10th year, is based on people's own assessment of their happiness, as well as economic and social data.
